author: sky.cactus
content: There are a few groups building Rollup solutions.  All of them are "close" to mainnet release I think.

author: sky.cactus
content: No changes to Ethereum are necessary for rollups to exist.  It is unclear what specific changes would make rollups easier either.

author: lmat1
content: <@!301186049323958275> Thank you for that clarification. One thing that has helped me understand the whole idea a bit better is Compound Chain (whitepaper published some 18 hours ago). I assume this is one way "rollups" are intended to look as Mr. Buterin has been espousing the idea for quite some time.

author: sky.cactus
content: I have no idea if Compound is using a rollup or if they are using something that they *call* a rollup.

author: lmat1
content: <@!301186049323958275> Right, no telling! Well... time will tell.

author: evanvanness
content: loopring and matterlabs zk-rollup have both been live for 6+ months.    Deverisifi also has a rollup-ish type thing where they give the data to a 10 member committee (instead of on-chain) and if there's fraud then only 1 of the committee needs to be honest.  they call that Validium
